solution_line_template: Stephanie has paid three-quarters of her gas bill, which is {gas_bill_cost} * {gas_bill_paid_fraction} = $<<{gas_bill_cost}*{gas_bill_paid_fraction}={gas_bill_paid_initial}>>{gas_bill_paid_initial}.

She then made another payment, which means she has paid {gas_bill_paid_initial} + {additional_gas_payment} =$<<{gas_bill_paid_initial}+{additional_gas_payment}={total_gas_bill_paid}>>{total_gas_bill_paid} of her gas bill.
She has paid half of her water bill, which is {water_bill_cost} * {water_bill_paid_fraction} = $<<{water_bill_cost}*{water_bill_paid_fraction}={water_bill_paid}>>{water_bill_paid}.

She has made {num_internet_payments} payments towards her internet bill, which is a total of {num_internet_payments} * {internet_payment_amount} = $<<{num_internet_payments}*{internet_payment_amount}={internet_bill_paid}>>{internet_bill_paid}.

Overall, she has made payments of {electricity_bill_paid} + {total_gas_bill_paid} + {water_bill_paid} + {internet_bill_paid} = $<<{electricity_bill_paid}+{total_gas_bill_paid}+{water_bill_paid}+{internet_bill_paid}={total_paid_amount}>>{total_paid_amount}.
Therefore, she still has to pay {total_bills_cost} - {total_paid_amount} = $<<{total_bills_cost}-{total_paid_amount}={remaining_payment}>>{remaining_payment}.
